page.title: 04Farming, Swanton Morley
page.content:
This is primarily an area of intensive, arable farming. The land is relatively flat and the soil light, making for highly mechanised farming. Although many hedgerows have been removed to increase field sizes, many copses and tree-lined field boundaries remain.
The three major crops grown are:- barley, wheat and sugar beet. Others include oil seed rape, peas, carrots, beans and potatoes.
The low lying land in the valley of the River Wensum has been recently drained and is now used as pasture land for beef and dairy cattle.
